title: Chloe Madeley shares lingerie photo on Instagram after toning bottom
text:
She has won a legion of new Instagram followers thanks to her love for health and fitness.

And Chloe Madeley, 32, has candidly discussed her plight in obtaining the perfect bottom as she shared a snap in her lingerie on Thursday.

Cheekily beginning by saying: 'If you follow for my nudes, here's my a**' the exercise enthusiast went onto inform her following of some gruelling exercises that could do to grow their derriere.

Bottoms up! Chloe Madeley, 32, has candidly discussed her plight in obtaining the perfect bottom as she shared a snap in her lingerie on Thursday.

Chloe showcased her toned figure in a neon pink sports bra and black bottoms for the Instagram snap.

She added atop the image: 'If you follow for the nudes, here's my a**. This has been a long time in the making, but as I said last week, if you are quad dominant like me, focus more on exercises like hip thrusts, abductors and kicks backs.

'Squatting doesn't grow EVERYONE's a**.'

This comes after Chloe admitted her obsession with chasing the perfect figure left her 'exhausted and burnt out'.

The fitness guru penned an empowering Instagram post, telling her followers she has accepted 'cellulite, weight gain and clothes size increases' while taking four months off her gruelling regime to enjoy the summer.

The TV personality revealed it was an intervention from her rugby player husband James Haskell, 34, that helped save her from further damage by encouraging her to 'take time out to travel, eat, drink and be social'.

Meanwhile, James spoke to MailOnline last month and said that having children was 'not a priority' for he and Chloe at the moment.

He also revealed that the pair are looking to celebrate their marriage in a bigger way in 2021 because of the Rugby World Cup this year.

He said: 'Yeah, unfortunately because of the World Cup, everyone has taken up 2020 with all their wedding stuff.

'We are looking at 2021 to do this bigger party. We've been to some amazing weddings this summer and I think we are really keen on having that party to celebrate all our friends and bring them all together. More so than anything else.

'We are really enjoying being married but I think it is important to… we want to celebrate that, we did it in such a small intimate way, it will be great to celebrate it.'
